Authors:
Xu Yue, Qiu Tianyi, Gao Siyu, Si Lu, Zhen Jincheng, Yu
Hongjia, Meng Wei, Xu Lijian
Title:
Arxiella longispora, a new fungal species with cellulolytic
and antifungal activities from forest litters in China
Abstract:
Arxiella longispora was isolated from forest litters in
Northeast China. This new species is morphologically characterized by
its shape and dimension of conidia and colonies on PDA and MEA.
Multi-gene phylogenetic analysis based on a four-gene dataset consisting
of the ITS1-5.8S-ITS2 (ITS) region and 28S (LSU) of the ribosomal DNA,
partial DNA-directed RNA polymerase II subunit (rpb2) and transcription
elongation factor 1 alpha (tef1) supported the placement of A.
longispora in the genus Arxiella as a new species. A. longispora showed
cellulolytic activities and wheat bran and peptone were optimal carbo A.
longispora n and nitrogen sources for the cellulolytic activities, in
particular CMCase, Avicelase and Î²-glucosidase activities, of A.
longispora, respectively. Crude extracts of A. longispora showed an
activity against Rhizoctonia solani CCTCC AF 2021031, which is the first
reported antifungal activity of Arxiella species.
